block.p: Andrea Lynn Stock, a daughter of Evelyn M. Stock and Dr. Howard F. Stock of Scarsdale, N.Y., was married last evening in New Rochelle, N.Y., to Richard Thomas Spaar, the son of Carol Spaar and Ronald J. Spaar of Allentown, Pa. The Rev. Sarah Brown, a Lutheran minister, officiated at the Fountainhead, a caterer, with Rabbi Jerry Heller taking part.

Mrs. Spaar, 27, works in human resources at the Emigrant Savings Bank in New York, training employees in banking and computer skills. She graduated from Pace University. Her father, a retired psychiatrist, practiced in Scarsdale and was a president of the Westchester Psychiatric Society. Her mother is the vice president of the board of education for the Southern Westchester Board of Cooperative Educational Services in Rye Brook, N.Y., and a member of the Scarsdale Planning Board.

Andrea Lynn Stock, a daughter of Evelyn M. Stock and Dr. Howard F. Stock of Scarsdale, N.Y., was married last evening in New Rochelle, N.Y., to Richard Thomas Spaar, the son of Carol Spaar and Ronald J. Spaar of Allentown, Pa. The Rev. Sarah Brown, a Lutheran minister, officiated at the Fountainhead, a caterer, with Rabbi Jerry Heller taking part.

Mrs. Spaar, 27, works in human resources at the Emigrant Savings Bank in New York, training employees in banking and computer skills. She graduated from Pace University. Her father, a retired psychiatrist, practiced in Scarsdale and was a president of the Westchester Psychiatric Society. Her mother is the vice president of the board of education for the Southern Westchester Board of Cooperative Educational Services in Rye Brook, N.Y., and a member of the Scarsdale Planning Board.

Mr. Spaar, 31, is a project manager for computerized bond-trading systems at Bloomberg, the business news and information company in New York. He graduated from Muhlenberg College. His father is a foreman at the Butz Company, a construction business in Allentown.
